text: Small businesses here in #NC10 can receive much-needed assistance from the #PaycheckProtectionProgram during the #coronavirus health crisis. I’ve answered some frequently asked questions to help small businesses better understand how the #PPP can help → https://t.co/1SgabPelcM

The #PaycheckProtectionProgram is here to help small businesses in #NC10 maintain their payroll during this unprecedented public health crisis. I encourage all small businesses to learn more about how the #PPP can help them during these challenging times. https://t.co/cO5SZJzw6a

Beginning today, small businesses can apply for the #PaycheckProtectionProgram. These forgivable loans will help keep employees on payroll and make sure #NC10 small businesses are ready when America is once again open for business. Learn more here: https://t.co/OEjl8XYn2g

Today is #CensusDay! Since 1790, the U.S. has counted its population every 10 years as required by the U.S. Constitution. Do your part to help #NC10 by filling out the #2020Census whether its online, over the phone, or by mail. Visit https://t.co/i9tJ1I4xIu to learn more. https://t.co/0mT9vFyZov

With the American people in need, they are choosing instead to pursue their progressive policy goals that have NO chance of becoming law.

There is no time for @HouseDemocrats & @SenateDems’s political games. The American people are suffering & need our help now. Passage of the #CARESAct would provide vitally important #coronavirusrelief for Americans immediately. Let's get it done. https://t.co/iJsVG2rwD6

#Reminder for @SenateDems: 68 million Americans work for an employer with more than 500 employees. The #CARESAct provides support for our small businesses, but also businesses that undoubtedly employ someone YOU represent. Let's pass this bill to support all workers.

The #CARESAct provides $425 billion to our most distressed businesses—supporting millions of employees—and allowing the Fed to leverage trillions of dollars of dire economic relief.
 
This isn't a handout, it's a hand-up for American workers.

This is not a crisis caused by a specific industry or corporation; it’s the voluntary shutdown of our economy in order to save lives.
 
As a result, our government needs to support the families and #smallbusiness folks who are directly feeling the pain of this national emergency.

Democrats are playing politics with the health and safety of the American people.
 
#ICYMI, Senate Democrats voted down even considering a bipartisan bill that would provide direct assistance to millions of Americans in this critical time → https://t.co/mEtzMzRyXu
